New Records: Dodgers set a record for most walks in a four-game postseason stretch with 31 walks in NLCS Games 1-4
Dodgers set a record for consecutive postseason games with at least seven walks with four games
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff laser beam for a 1-0 lead
Mookie Betts had four hits in the game
Tommy Edman had two run-scoring doubles in the game
Max Muncy walked three times and ran his on-base streak to 12 consecutive plate appearances
Teoscar Hern√°ndez walked twice in the game and ran his total to six walks in the series
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers had a plan to not give in to the nibble and to force the Mets to pitch in the zone
The Dodgers' hitters discussed the Mets' pitcher Jose Quintana's tendency to pick around the strike zone with precision
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza praised the Dodgers' lineup and said they're going to force you in the zone and not chase
Max Muncy said the Dodgers are finding their stride and that the clubhouse coming together is a big difference in the postseason
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers are one more good day away from the World Series
The Dodgers' focus started in the hitters' meeting before the game
The Dodgers' deep lineup is forcing the Mets to pitch in the zone and making them pay when they don't execute
